page.title: 08CROPS
page.content: Most of land in our area is used for grazing and growing grass for silage but a few crops are grown. Barley wheat, maize and potatoes are the main crops.Winter and Spring barley are both grown and harvested but they are only grown in the same field for three years.Sowing them in a different field after that time prevents the spread of viruses.The potatoes have to be sown in a different field each year otherwise wire worms attack the crop. Weeds also ruin the potatoes by taking the goodness out of the soil, so they are sprayed with weedkiller. Farmers also use fertilizers made up of potash, nitrogen and phosphate to encourage good, strong, heaalthy plants.The maize is grown to turn into silage for feed for the animals during the winter.
